text.cookies-text: We use cookies on this site to enhance your user experience. By clicking the 'Accept' button you agree to us doing so.

text.validator-creditcard: Please enter a valid credit card number

text.validator-min-part: Please enter a value greater than or equal to
text.home-intro-based: SimplyMinimalMVC is a simple MVC based on:
text.home-offer-pt1: Code-ready minimal structure. Download and go.
text.home-offer-pt2: One-Page HTML application that accepts multi-file for better application composition.
text.home-offer-pt4: Built-in Analytics integrated support, that permits tracking on sections without recharging your site.
text.home-offer-pt5: Front-end simple built-in form Validation system based on Jquery Validate Version 1.9.2
text.home-offer-pt6-part1: SASS/SCSS built-in variables. (You may need a SCSS/SASS intalled in your PC, and
text.home-offer-pt7: Built-in Models to easily connect Back-end to DataBase.
text.home-offer-pt8: Back-end built-in simple parameter input Validation system.
text.home-offer-others-pt0: Some CSS and jQuery useful functions top save time.
text.home-offer-others-pt3: Using LocalStorage to preserve configuration variables.
text.home-offer-others-pt4: Front-end to Back-end easy built-in Asynchronous communication system. (AJAX)
text.home-offer-others-pt5: SimplyMinimalMVC is 100% free to use and 100% adds-free.
text.home-frontend-structure-description-pt1: Structure: We use includeHTML() function to compile all views into one document, which allows to parse html in folders for better segmentation.
text.home-frontend-structure-description-pt2: Translations: We use 'key' parameter in html for language translations. Key parameter is our dictionary entry in our json translation files in assets/locales folder. Translations can include html inside, altought it is not recommended to add complex html in translations.
text.home-frontend-structure-description-pt3: Modals: Modal windows can be easily generated and activated. They are all inside /front/view/pages/modals folder, and are declated (and included in our html file) from /front/view/container/modals.html file. To show and hide modals, just call: toggleModal('modalId') where modalId is the modal ID which we want to interact with. So every modal MUST have an ID.
text.home-frontend-structure-description-pt4: Sections: To change the currently displayed section, just use function showBodySection('sectionId'). Altought no changes in URL will be apreciated, there is a Google analytics tool that will be sensible to this changes (if set) and also breadcrumbs will be generated (if set).
text.home-frontend-structure-description-pt5: Analytics: To activate Google Analytics substitution tool, you should go to /front/js/lib/analytics.js and interact with googleAnalyticsSectionsObject variable. (You should have a GA account first and add a the key in googleAnalyticsKey and also change the hostname variable)
text.home-frontend-structure-description-pt6: Breadcrumbs: For a correct use of Breadcrumbs tool, the section we want to show must be in translates files with the key: 'section-'+sectionId.
text.home-frontend-structure-description-pt7: Form Validation: Based in jQuery-Validate; just remember to add a 'name' parameter into every field input of the form for verification purpouses. Also remember to add them in validateFormsOnInit() and sendForm() functions, inside /front/js/lib/validators.js, to define its behaviour. There is five field 'names' that automatically validate: email, name, message, age and weight. You can declare other identifiers (names) for inputs with its own validators here. Note: You can see every validation types in changeValidationLang() function.
